I actually have some qualms with the recent champions lately... they're way too specialized for their roles making all other options obsolete. Rek'Sai is the ultimate jungler: closes the gap with burrow and pops people up when emerging from the ground. Kalista can kite like no ones business and her ult is just ridiculous- it saves your support or is a great engage for champs like Morg, Blitz, and Thresh. Now this support is just given roaming capabilities, putting him ahead of everyone else because he gets experience while doing it... Maybe it'll be balanced- I don't know, but there surely is a trend of heavily specialized champions lately and I feel like that might make the meta one-dimensional. I could be talking out of my butt, but I would like to hear opinions and perspectives to reach a better understanding.

I understand what you are saying, and its not just that they are making the new champions to fit just one specific role, they are doing it to the older champions aswell, for example, Alistar *"So we made changes, nerfed his extra monster damage, and put him back in his traditional support pants."* I prefer having a more versatile champion instead of a specific role/lane champion where it isn't viable in any other roles, it allows the players to experiment with champions/roles instead of picking a champion and knowing they can only go one place.
Another thought actually, you could probably use this new champion in the jungle.

Edit: also, how does the meep respawn mechanic work?  Is it a timer, or are there conditions that have to be met to summon the next meep?
